Description: Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated and looking l, at the centre of a group of nude and fully attired figures, including one wearing a crown Oil, over charcoal, on grey paper
Curator's comments: For an introduction to the series of St Antony, see under no. 1907-7-17-42. Emphasis is here given to the saint's temptation with wordly goods as in the other sheets listed under no. 1907-7-17-45. Other squared drawings in this series are nos. 1907-7-17-49, 54, 60, 63 (although this seems to be a copy) and 64. For a comment about Domenico Tintoretto and squaring see under no. 1907-7-17-1. 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series. Lit.: H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no.1526/59, p. 265
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
